page.title: 09NORTH CREAKE LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: This is a pre-Conquest village, with a Saxon Lord in the days of the Danelaw. Of the three Norman Manors, two are now in the possession of Cambridge University Colleges; the third is the property of Earl Spencer. There were two medieval churches, St Michaels, ruined at the Dissolution, and the existing St Mary's Church. The latter was rebuilt in its present form in the fifteenth century. The outlines of two of the Manor Houses may be traced in fields opposite the Church. This suggests that the original settlement was developed in this area, alongside the River Burn. The village spread was to the North, so the Church is close to the Southern boundary of the parish. N Creake is a good example of a linear village, the pattern being similar to that shown on a map of 1600.
